epp:phrases.epp:phrase: If appropriate fill out the fields to map a geographical bounding box where this data was collected. If you do not have this information or do not think it is relevant simply leave the field fields blank.
Longitude of the east most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area

Alternative title of the item. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. If there is a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Latitude of the north most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area
Latitude of the south most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area
Latitude of the west most point of an imaginary square placed around the sample area
Describe the methodology which resulted in this data collection, including information on the sampled entities.
If provided enter the grant number or identifier for this research or its parent project.
Information about the source of any data or data element not derived from previous work, and any changes made to this data prior to deposit.
You may stipulate any specific requirements or limitations for re-use of this resource here.
Enter, if applicable, either the geographic regions in which your data collection was carried out or the spatial reference system used.
Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council
Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council
Enter keywords or phrases associated with this dataset, seperated by commas (,)
Please select an appopriate data type(s) found within this collection. If a suitable category is not listed, select 'Other'.
Enter any additional accreditation you wish to give for the production of this data collection.
The organisation or public body that funded the research responsible for generating this data.
The date that data collection was completed.
The temporal range to which this dataset applies. E.g. If this is data pertaining to a historical period enter the bounding dates.

Enter a description of any legal or ethical issues encountered in generating the data, and how these were dealt with. E.g. Risk of disclosing participants identities was mitigated by removing references to real names and other identifying information.
Language of any written material in the data collection.
Use this field for any useful information about your deposit that can't be entered anywhere else. This information will appear on the public summary page for this item.
If this data collection was created as part of a larger project, then indicate the title of this parent project here. This will link it with of multiple data collections.
Please state here whether your deposit has been published (or is currently in the process of being published) prior to deposit here.
Original publication URL for this item.
State the copyright holding individuals and/or organisations.

The content of this document as opposed to the format. If you are uploading zipped bundles of files then please select 'Mixed', or 'Full Archive' if the bundle contains all the files in this collection.
Enter a brief description of this item
You may set an embargo period for this item, which will then not be available for download until the date specified.

The title of the item. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. If there is a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Example: A brief history of time
Example: Life: an unauthorised biography
Example: Mathematics for engineers and scientists. 5th edition
Example: Ecosystems of the world. Vol. 26. Estuaries of the world
A written description of the data collection. If the data collection has an abstract then this should be entered here.

Please select at least one main subject category, and optionally up to two other subject categories you think are appropriate for your submission, from the list below. Please note that there may not be a perfect fit for your particular subject area - please select the closest match or a high level term.
The departmental divisions with which this item should be associated.

Enter in format indicated below. If this data has been published, all authors should be listed here. If there are more than four creators, click on the [More input rows] button.
Example: [Smith] [J.P.] [j.smith@soton.ac.uk]
Example: [Chance-Collins] [Chris] [chris@bar.com]
Example: [Fu] [Yan-Li] []
Example: [von Höpfner] [Ludwig G.] []
Companies or other corporate bodies that were involved in the creation of this data collection e.g. an external laboratory.
Please select an appopriate data type(s) found within this collection. If a suitable category is not listed, select 'Other'.
Enter details of related resources. E.g. publications based on this data.

If this data collection has been published prior to deposit here, please state by whom. Do not use abbreviations, enter in full.
Example: Oxford University Press
If this data collection has been published prior to deposit here, please provide an associated date of release.
If there are access restrictons on any of the documents in this collection, requests to view these items will be sent to this email address. The email address will not be made public.
Enter any information or comments for the repository editorial staff. This information will not be displayed to the public.

Selecting a security level will determine who is able to download this document. If you set this to anything other than "Anyone" then consider adding a contact email for this collection (on the next page of this deposit process); this will allow users to request a copy of the document through a web form and you to grant access at your discretion.

This field is for the records DOI. By default this field is only visible to staff. If you want to change it you will have to edit your workflow XML. You may need to read this: http://wiki.eprints.org/w/Workflow_Format. In any case you should probably change this phrase using the "Edit page phrases" link.
